Dugan tagged Welsh. As the inning closed Taylor and Ump Pfirman got into a heated discussion evidently arising from Taylor's criticism of Pfirman's judgment of balls and strikes.  Evers and Maranville dragged the irate player away from the equally irate umpire and steered him into the Braves' dugout.

Lindstrom smothered the smash but could not make a play on Dugan.

On a sacrifice bunt try, Lindstrom ran into Hendrick and in the judgment of Ump Pfirman, knocked the ball out of Hendrick's hand as he was tagged.  Because it was ruled to be interference by Lindstrom, Terry was ordered back to 1B.
Mgr McGraw notified the umpires that because of Pfirman's decision sending Terry back to 1B, the Giants would play the balance of the game under protest.

Hit on right shoulder. It was a painful injury and the game was delayed a few minutes.  But Cohen got up and trotted to 1B.
Crawford, not meaning to hit the ball, failed to pull his bat back quickly enough and tapped to McGraw.

s/s has no fielderst, but box score indicated fielders on this DP

Manager McGraw EJECTED by Ump Magerkurth. Ump Magerkurth held up the game to warn somebody on the Giant bench to keep quiet, and when his warning went unheeded, he ordered McGraw to leave the dugout.  McGraw was slow to comply and Magerkurth pulled out his watch as a sign that if McGraw lingered too long he would forfeit the game.  McGraw finally departed and the game was resumed. There were further remarks from the Giant dugout and again Magerkurth held up the game.  After a few moments wait he was apparently satisfied McGraw had gone. This was the first time in several years that McGraw was banished by an umpire.

Ford threw past Dressen to the grandstand.  Kelly recovered it, but when his throw to the plate bounced out of Gooch's glove, Leach tried to score from 3B. Reporter did not charge Kelly or Gooch with error here.

Genewich EJECTED by Ump Pfirman. Pfirman held up the game for a moment to order Joe Genewich to leave the Giant dugout and go to the clubhouse presumably because Genewich had been annoying him with comments from the dugout.
Into lower tier of RF stands
Hit the top of upper deck of LF stands
Running catch; Donohue apparently thought there were 2 outs
Walker tried to pull away from the pitch but it hit his bat and lobbed a single over Jackson's head.
Against upper tier of LF stands
Tried to steal while Scott held ball and was an easy out
Fine 1-hand catch after a hard run
Leach wrenched his left leg running the bases
Fine fielding by Ott held it to a single
Purdy EJECTED by Ump McLaughlin.  Purdy had been called out on strikes last inning and it was presumed that he had continued to criticize the umpire.
Reds' manager Hendricks EJECTED by McLaughlin. Then McLaughlin EJECTED Luque, Rixey, Pittenger, May, and Ehrhardt.

'Ott appeared at bat after Farrell in the 3rd inning. There was an outcry from the fans in the stands that the Giants were batting out of order.  Bill Terry came to the screen in front of the press box and explained that Manager McGraw had written the batting order wrong at the start of the game and it was now reversed with Ott batting ahead of Terry.'
